thread.title: REDLANDS: Arrowhead-making presentation slated
thread.title_full: REDLANDS: Arrowhead-making presentation slated - Press Enterprise

author: AMY ZAHN
title: REDLANDS: Arrowhead-making presentation slated
text:
By AMY ZAHN / CONTRIBUTING WRITER
Published: Oct. 23, 2015 1:33 p.m. REDLANDS: Arrowhead-making presentation slated Print Photo Share Pin It 1 of 2 More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Related article » The Redlands Art Association will host a presentation by paleontologist James Bowden at 7 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 27 on “The Art of Flintknapping” at 215 E. State Street. Bowden has dedicated years of his life to flintknapping, or chiseling arrowheads. He has taught flintknapping on television, as well as to a group of Marine Corps survival skills instructors.
Bowden will also be holding a workshop from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 31 at the same location. Participants must be at least 18. The workshop is $50 for Redlands Art Association members and $65 for nonmembers, with a $10 materials fee to be paid to the instructor.
Information: 909-792-8435
Contact the writer: community@pe.com
